rComments: Great class if you are interested in documentary film theory. You watch a video every class and discuss heady topics. Readings are long but I only read about half of them. All readings where on ecommons and they where often bad photocopies, hence my lack of reading. I got an A-

I liked her, she's smart and knows what she's talking about. You watch a new film every class, it's a cool course. Had three papers, you have to incorporate the readings into them, was not too bad as I barely read. Took a draft to her office hours and she's helpful. Somewhat unclear but it's due to the whole class not having formal film knowledge.

Assigns about 5-6 articles to read each week. In class, we watch the films and discuss the film. Sounds easy right? She barely lectures on terms, unorganized lectures, and doesn't really cover the theoretical concepts. You will get frustrated during her lectures. It does not seem she has teaching/lecturing experience. The articles teaches more.
